comment:
Okay, okay.  I have to call BS on the story about being on the island when Johnny supposedly spilled wine on her lap in front of his son, Jack.  I don't buy the story.  I don't buy that a woman who was slapped up against a wall and told she would be killed was also rolling her eyes at the guy who did that.  No.  A victim doesn't roll her eyes when she just got slammed against a wall, pinned by her neck and told she is going to be killed.  If her version were true, then she would be a frightened victim who had been subjected to violence, a "hostage" situation, and rape for 3 years.  A victim subjected to that level of "violence" would be scared to flinch, and certainly wouldn't be arguing back or rolling her eyes at her "violent" abuser. That whole story is garbage.

Her claim is one minute she's in the bathroom with Johnny taunting her, next second she's asking Jack to go somewhere.  Where was Jack?  He was in the kitchen.  So she's in the bathroom asking Jack who is in the kitchen to go somewhere to get him out of the way.  If they were so close that he could see what was going on, than Jack would be a witness, and he's not and neither is Lily Rose.  Frankly, Johnny's children have not corroborated either of the stories that include them.

She continues the story that they left the house and got into a scuffle and she says to herself, this can't happen again we just went through this weeks ago, and then throws a can a paint thinner at the back of Johnny's head, when Tara arrives and witnesses the altercation.  (They also discuss this in the tapes, and Amber never mentions the rest of the story she tells here or claims she was defending herself.) Again, this doesn't line up with the story.  The story is that Johnny dumped wine in her lap, she went to change, he slammed her against the wall and pinner her by the neck, she rolled her eyes at him and he taunted her.  So didn't she just have a scuffle a few minutes ago, not weeks ago.  Her stories don't make sense.  They aren't cohesive.  It's like she tells stories in isolation and then tries to weave them together but they don't weave together because they are lies and as lies, they don't line up.

I recall that Amber wormed her way into the Christmas 2015 trip to the island, that Johnny didn't want her there.  She tells the story the other way around.  Her friends weren't there because they weren't invited, not because they didn't want to go.  She went on the trip to remove all her personal belongings ahead of her hooking up with Elon Musk, whom she had waiting in the wings.

The whole story about Kate James is not believable.  I don't believe that Kate "gently touched' the scratch over Amber's eye.  That's the way a mother would behave, not an employee.  She describes Kate as on the one hand asking if Johnny were violent, and on the other hand discussing things with Johnny's staff and encouraging Amber to stay with a guy that Kate is supposed to believe is violent.  I don't believe it.  If Kate believed Johnny were violent, that would not have happened.  Amber's story is too inconsistent to be believable.  Normal people are consistent.  Normal caring women urge their friends to get out of a violent relationship.  Amber can't portray people consistently, because Amber doesn't know how victims behave (b/c she's not one) or how normal people react (because she's a sociopath.)

Lots of holes in her stories.  Hopefully, Johnny's attorneys can poke holes in her stories to show they are lies.  That's how you defeat a liar.
author: Been There
